moves.1... c5: This is one of the few times I've encounted the Sicilian on Gameknot. I'm well prepared against it.
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6: Develops a piece and controls the centre.
moves.3. c3: I bet he was expecting the normal d4. I decided to throw him off a bit by playing c3.
moves.3... d6: I like e6 here better for black.
moves.4. d4: Strikes the centre. NOw I will have 2 centre pawns on d4 and e4.
moves.4... cxd4 5. cxd4 Nf6 6. Nc3: Develops the knight and defends the pawn.
moves.6... Bg4 7. Be3: Protects the pawn on d4. THis wasn't neccesary since I could capture the bishop with my g pawn if he captured my knight. I would then have an open g file and castling for black would be walknig into an death trap or ambush.
moves.7... e6: Black contents himself with a small pawn centre. This prepare tio develop the DSB.
moves.8... a6 9. Ba4 b5 10. Bc2 Nb4 11. Bb1: I still wanted to eye the e4 pawn.
moves.11... Be7 12. a3 Nc6 13. h3 Bh5 14. Qd2: Now I tempt him to capture the knight by moving my queen and unpinning it.
moves.18... Nh5 19. Ne2: Prepare for an f4 pawn storm. I wanted to play h4,h5 and start a kingside attack.
moves.20... Nc5 21. Bc2 Bf6 22. Rc1 Bg7: Black has wasted a lot of time manouvering his pieces.
moves.23. Bxg7 Nxg7 24. f4 Qh4: My  Queen can now infiltrate via a5.
moves.25. Qa5 Qxf4: HOrrible blunder. THis secured a victory for me.
